description: In this course students work to develop competence in Norwegian culture, history and society
through a survey of the state and politics and the Norwegian population. Through these topics,
students learn about important moments in Norwegian history. They explore some of the most
important debates that are taking place in Norway now, and learn to formulate themselves in
several oral and written contexts, including informative presentations and discussion and
argumentative texts. Prerequisite: NORW 232 or by placement test.
